update.description:
This is inspired by this [question](http://answers.gazebosim.org/question/7591/knowing-if-a-model-is-selected/).

The `~/selection` topic is used to publish when a model is selected or deselected. You can see output using: `gz topic -e /gazebo/default/selection`
update.title: Publish model selection

content.raw: Mutex added.
content.html: Mutex added.

content.raw: It doesn't hurt anything.
content.html: It doesn't hurt anything.

content.raw: I was debugging why this test was broken, and wanted to add a verification that the main window was successfully created.
content.html: I was debugging why this test was broken, and wanted to add a verification that the main window was successfully created.

content.raw: It works for me. Just a few suggestions but ready to accept.
content.html: It works for me. Just a few suggestions but ready to accept.

content.raw: Just out of curiosity, why did you change `mainWindow` to a pointer?
content.html: Just out of curiosity, why did you change mainWindow to a pointer?

content.raw: Do we need a mutex here or in `OnSetSelectedEntity`? It seems that `OnSetSelectedEntity()` reads and modifies a few member variables.
content.html: Do we need a mutex here or in OnSetSelectedEntity? It seems that OnSetSelectedEntity() reads and modifies a few member variables.

content.raw: We could remove the block from line 170 to line 176.
content.html: We could remove the block from line 170 to line 176.

content.raw: Currently, if you click repeatedly on a selected model, the selection messages will arrive after each mouse click even though there is no change in selection state. Should the message only fire when there is a change in selection state?
content.html: Currently, if you click repeatedly on a selected model, the selection messages will arrive after each mouse click even though there is no change in selection state. Should the message only fire when there is a change in selection state?

content.raw: That is correct. This PR is just about changes in selection status. Issue #1382 captures your second question.
content.html: That is correct. This PR is just about changes in selection status. Issue #1382 captures your second question.

content.raw: I had to split the GLWidget test into two files. See issue #1381.
content.html: I had to split the GLWidget test into two files. See issue #1381.

update.description:
This is inspired by this [question](http://answers.gazebosim.org/question/7591/knowing-if-a-model-is-selected/).

The `~/selection` topic is used to publish when a model is selected or deselected. You can see output using: `gz topic -e /gazebo/default/selection`
update.title: Publish model selection

content.raw: So `~/selection` is just telling about changes in selection status? What if you wanted to get a list of all selected objects in an atomic operation?
content.html: So ~/selection is just telling about changes in selection status? What if you wanted to get a list of all selected objects in an atomic operation?

content.raw: It works with multiple objects. Each object that is selected or deselected is reported.
content.html: It works with multiple objects. Each object that is selected or deselected is reported.

content.raw: I agree, I think this is an important feature.
content.html: I agree, I think this is an important feature.

content.raw: More specifically, should selection.proto be updated to allow for selection of multiple objects?
content.html: More specifically, should selection.proto be updated to allow for selection of multiple objects?

content.raw: What about selecting multiple objects?
content.html: What about selecting multiple objects?

content.raw: confirmed
content.html: confirmed

content.raw: conflicts
content.html: conflicts

content.raw: When a model is selected and then deleted, a "selected: false" message for that model is never sent. It's arguable whether or not this is needed, though I wanted to point it out for completeness.
content.html: When a model is selected and then deleted, a "selected: false" message for that model is never sent. It's arguable whether or not this is needed, though I wanted to point it out for completeness.

content.raw: I also fixed the MainWindow unit test.
content.html: I also fixed the MainWindow unit test.
